Alright, I'm trying to figure out where and when the action of this play is set. The metadata tells me it's a tragedy by Charenton from 1662, but that's just when it was published, not necessarily when the story takes place.

Looking at the context, the top person mentioned is Nabal with high frequency. From the related sentences, Nabal seems to be interacting with royalty and involved in battles, which might indicate a historical or biblical setting. The title mentions "Baltazar," which I think is a reference to Belshazzar, a Babylonian king from the Bible. So maybe the play is set in ancient Babylon.

The places mentioned include Paris, but since the publication was in 1662 and Paris is where the privilege was granted, that's likely about the printing, not the setting of the play itself. The lack of other place mentions beyond Paris doesn't help much for location; it might be inferred to be Babylon based on the title.

For the timeframe, if it's about Baltazar (Belshazzar), who was a historical figure around 500 B.C.E., that would set the period in ancient times. So I'd estimate the timeframe start around -600 and end at -400 to cover his time.
